transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Good afternoon, madam, I’m Neha from Airtel Support. There’s an urgent issue with your mobile number. It will be deactivated in 2 hours if you don’t update your KYC.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Deactivated? But I already did my KYC last year. What’s going on?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, due to new government rules, we need to re-verify your Aadhaar details. Please call this number—98765-43210—and provide the code we send you.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I haven’t heard about any new rules. Can you send me an official email or message?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, there’s no time for emails! Your number will be blocked, and you won’t be able to make calls or use internet. Think about your family—how will you contact them?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That’s true, I need my phone for emergencies. But this sounds a bit odd. Why can’t I do this at an Airtel store?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, stores are closed for Diwali preparations. This is the only way. Just call the number now, or you’ll lose your connection.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not sure. Let me check with Airtel’s official customer care first.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, don’t delay! If you don’t act, we can’t help you later. Call now!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I think I’ll stick to verifying this myself. Thanks, but I’m hanging up.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, please reconsider! Your number is at risk!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’ll take the chance and check with Airtel. Bye.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hey, Priya! Just got a message that my Amazon order is out for delivery today!

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, nice, Anjali! What did you order? Something for the house?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Yeah, a set of diyas for Diwali. I wanted something traditional this year.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: That’s so sweet! Are they the clay ones or something fancy?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Clay ones with pretty designs. Thought they’d look nice on the balcony.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Perfect! You’re getting into the Diwali spirit early, huh?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Haha, yeah! Gotta start decorating soon. Are you doing anything special?

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Oh, same! I’m planning to make some rangoli this time. Maybe we can do it together?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That’d be fun! Let’s plan after my delivery arrives. I’ll call you.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Sure, let me know. By the way, did the delivery guy give an exact time?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, just said ‘by evening.’ Fingers crossed it’s not delayed like last time.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Haha, I know that pain! Mumbai traffic, na? Always a gamble.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Exactly! Alright, I’ll update you once it’s here. We’ll have chai and plan.

transcript.speaker: person 2
transcript.message: Deal! Looking forward to seeing those diyas. Talk soon!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Bye, Priya!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, madam, this is Priya from SBI Customer Care. Your bank account has been flagged for suspicious activity.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, Priya. What kind of suspicious activity? I haven’t done anything unusual.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, someone tried to withdraw a large amount using your Aadhaar-linked account. We need to secure it immediately.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Oh my God, that’s scary! But I didn’t get any SMS or email from SBI.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: That’s because it’s an emergency, madam. Please visit http://secure.sbi-verify.com and update your details right now.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Wait, I’ve heard about fake websites. How do I know this is real?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, this is urgent! If you don’t act now, your account will be frozen by tonight.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Frozen? That sounds serious, but I’ll go to the branch instead.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: No, madam, branches are closed due to Diwali holidays. Use the link or call our helpline at 1800-555-1234 to verify.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this. I’ll check with SBI directly on their official number.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, don’t delay! Your savings are at risk. Just click the link, it takes two minutes.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I don’t trust random links. I’m hanging up now.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, please, this is for your safety! Don’t lose your money!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I said I’ll verify it myself. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Wait, madam, last chance to save your account!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello madam, this is Rohan from JioTV Premium Support. Your subscription is about to lapse, and you’ll lose access to all channels by midnight. Renew now for just ₹499.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, I think I already paid for JioTV last month. Why is this happening again?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, there was a glitch in our system, and your payment didn’t register. You need to update it urgently on http://jiotv-renew-pay.com to avoid disconnection.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, I don’t remember any issues. Can I check this on the Jio app instead?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: No, madam, the app won’t show this update yet. It’s a backend issue. If you don’t act now, you’ll miss important news and Diwali special shows. Please hurry!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not sure about this website. It doesn’t look like the official Jio site. Can you give me a reference number or something?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, no need for a reference. Just call our toll-free number 1800-999-1234 if you have doubts, but don’t delay the payment. Your family will be upset if the TV stops working.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: This feels suspicious. I’m not going to click on any link. I’ll contact Jio directly.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, please don’t risk it! Once the subscription lapses, reactivating it will cost double. Act now!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I don’t trust this. I’m hanging up and reporting this number.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Wait, madam! I’m only trying to help you!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, I’m done. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, madam, I’m calling from SBI Customer Care. Your account has been flagged for suspicious activity. We need to verify your details urgently.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Oh, really? I haven’t noticed anything wrong with my account. Who is this?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: I’m Priya Sharma, madam, from SBI Head Office. There’s a fraudulent transaction of Rs. 50,000 linked to your account. Please visit http://secure.sbi-verify.com to confirm your identity.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Wait, Rs. 50,000? That’s impossible! I didn’t do any such transaction.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, it’s very serious. If you don’t verify now, your account might be blocked within 24 hours. Just click the link and enter your details.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: But I’ve never received such calls from SBI before. Can you give me a reference number or something?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Of course, madam, the reference ID is SBI2023-URGENT-789. But time is running out. Please act fast, or you could lose all your savings.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: This sounds fishy. I think I’ll visit my branch instead. I don’t trust these links.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, the branch won’t help in time. This is a Diwali fraud alert. Hackers are targeting accounts during the festive season. Please don’t delay!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable sharing anything online. I’ll call SBI’s official number to check.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, don’t hang up! If you don’t act now, we won’t be responsible for your loss. Just one click on http://secure.sbi-verify.com!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, I’m not clicking anything. I think this is a scam. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, you’re making a big mistake! Your money is at stake!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m reporting this number. Don’t call me again.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste sir, congratulations! You’ve won ₹10 lakh in the Navratri Mega Lottery sponsored by SBI! Claim your prize now at http://sbi-lotterywin.com.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, but I never participated in any lottery. How did my name come up?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, your mobile number was selected randomly from millions during our festive promotion. Isn’t that lucky?

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hmm, sounds strange. Can you tell me who’s organizing this?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: It’s a reputed organization tied with SBI. You just need to pay a small processing fee of ₹5000 to unlock your winnings.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Processing fee? I’ve heard of scams like this. I’m not sure about paying anything.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, this is a limited-time offer! If you don’t act within 24 hours, the prize will go to someone else.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: 24 hours? That’s too urgent. Can you send me an official email or letter from SBI?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sorry sir, we don’t have time for paperwork. Just pay via UPI to this number 9876543210 and secure your ₹10 lakh!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this. I need to verify first with my bank.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Sir, don’t miss this golden chance! Think about your family this Navratri.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I appreciate the thought, but I’m not paying without proof. Please stop calling.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: You’re throwing away a fortune, sir! Last chance!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m hanging up now. Don’t call again.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Namaste, Madam, this is Karan from ICICI Bank Security Department. I’m calling about an urgent matter.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Namaste, Karan. What’s the matter? Is everything okay with my account?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, we’ve noticed a fraudulent attempt to withdraw ₹1 lakh from your account. It’s linked to your Aadhaar number.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Oh no! How could this happen? I haven’t shared my Aadhaar with anyone.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Don’t worry, Madam, but we need to secure your account now. Please visit http://icici-safeverify.com and update your details.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m a bit hesitant to click on any link. Can you send me an official email instead?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, email takes time, and this is urgent. If you delay, fraudsters might empty your account before Diwali shopping.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: That’s terrifying. But I think I’ll call the bank’s official number to confirm this.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, you can trust me. Just share your OTP, and I’ll block the transaction immediately.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, I’ve heard not to share OTPs with anyone. I’m not doing that.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Okay, Madam, then use the link or call our helpline at 1800-456-7890 to resolve this fast.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m sorry, but I’m not comfortable with this. I’ll visit my branch tomorrow.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, tomorrow could be too late! Your hard-earned money is at risk!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I understand, but I’m hanging up now. I’ll handle this directly with ICICI.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Please, Madam, don’t take this risk! Just follow my instructions!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, thank you. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Hello, madam, this is Neha from HDFC Bank. There’s an unauthorized transaction of ₹25,000 from your account. We need to block it now.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: Hello, Neha. What? ₹25,000? I didn’t make any such transaction!

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, it’s a fraud attempt. Please confirm your identity by visiting http://hdfc-securepay.com immediately to stop this.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: But I didn’t get any alert from the bank. How do I know this is genuine?

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, fraudsters disable alerts. This is why we’re calling you directly. Act fast, or you’ll lose your money!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: This sounds suspicious. I think I’ll check my account on the official HDFC app first.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, the app won’t show this yet. Use our secure link or call 1800-777-8899 to stop the transaction now.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not comfortable with this. I’ll visit the branch or call the official number.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, branches are too slow, and this is urgent! Think about your savings—don’t risk it before Diwali.

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I understand, but I’m not clicking any links. I’ll handle this myself.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, please, your money is at stake! Don’t ignore this warning!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: I’m not ignoring it, but I don’t trust this call. I’m hanging up.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Wait, madam, this is your last chance to save your funds!

transcript.speaker: person 1
transcript.message: No, thanks. Goodbye.

transcript.speaker: scammer
transcript.message: Madam, don’t regret this later!
